page.title: 20THE NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: {Enterprise Neptune}was launched 20 years ago to raise money for the National Trust (a charitable trust) to buy, improve and protect the natural beauty of stretches of coastline. Poldhu Cove has recently been bought with funds from this appeal. In 1982, Bristol University reported on how best to tackle the major erosion problems of the Cove. These are caused mainly by the large numbers of people using the beach and by people parking their cars on the beach, which together have destabilised the vegetated sand dunes which occur at the back of the cove. Now that the National Trust owns the Cove,it is hoped that, with the cooperation of the owners of the beach cafe, and Kerrier District Council who own a large car park on the landward side,to implement the report's recommendations
